intro: Stemodia lanceolata f. angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf stemodia, is a flowering plant belonging to the Acanthaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves that are typically narrower than those of the typical species. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are often clustered in whorls along the stems. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Its foliage and floral structure make it a distinctive addition to botanical gardens and conservation efforts.
